Entities.Name: Number of SDH
Entities.Definition: Total count of subdural hematomas identified in the CT scan report.

Sample Data.Sentence: The report indicated multiple instances of SDH.

Entities.Name: Size of Midline Shift
Entities.Definition: Measurement in millimeters of the midline shift caused by the largest SDH, indicative of the severity and potential for serious complications.

Sample Data.Sentence: There is associated mass effect with effacement of the adjacent left cerebral sulci and left lateral ventricle and 6-mm of rightward midline shift.

Entities.Name: Thickness of Largest SDH
Entities.Definition: Measurement in millimeters of the thickest part of the largest SDH, used to assess the severity of the hemorrhage.

Sample Data.Sentence: The component overlying the left cerebral convexity measures 11-mm and the tentorial component measures 15-mm.

Entities.Name: Side of Largest SDH
Entities.Definition: The location (left or right side of the brain) where the largest SDH is found, important for treatment and prognosis.

Sample Data.Sentence: Predominantly hyperdense subdural hematoma layering over the left cerebral convexity and left tentorium, measuring up to 15 mm in greatest diameter.

Dataset.Name: CT scan reports for subdural hematoma patients
Dataset.Details: The dataset consists of 643 cranial CT scan reports collected from a single center, annotated for the presence and characteristics of subdural hematoma.

Annotation Guidelines.Description: The algorithm's code and pattern-matching approach used for extracting data from CT scan reports are available publicly under a general public license for non-commercial use.
